data.title: No Big Deal
data.text: It seems like every town that wants to be perceived as trendy has to have an arts district.  This one was nothing special.  The outdoor sculptures around the downtown area were a bit pathetic, but that's just our opinions.  We've seen a lot of art districts so I'll admit that we're probably a bit jaded.  But the shops and galleries didn't stand out either.  Lots of art fair type things that sometimes border on crafts more than art. Not a single thing we would even consider for our house.  Even the galleries had less than inspiring pieces.  Everything was kind of so-so.

data.title: Just great
data.text: Super.  Stop at ot it's worth it  tell bruce you said hello, icon in Hamilton County , fun and easy to get you started

data.title: Cool stop in Indy
data.text: This was such an unexpected surprise in Indy!   Take the time to walk around and take in all the surprises - I think I lucked out with parking easily in the street.  Good choices for eating and people watching!

data.title: Nice area, very slow in the evenings
data.text: This place really seems to have the potential to be fun and can be if you head there with a group.  It's pretty, there are good restaurants, there are galleries and antique shops, and Main Street is frequently shut down to traffic for different festivals.  However, there's not much night life in this area.  (It's great for lunch, but parking can be tricky.) I wish some of restaurants were open later, but the area seems kind of dead most evenings. Take some friends, and start out kind of early.  You might need reservations at Woody's if you're planning a special dinner to be sure you won't have to wait. Some of our favorite restaurants are Woody's, Mudbugs, Bub's, and Bazbeaux's.

data.title: Nice place to walk around and explore
data.text: Fun little shops and restaurants...we went for a walk and explored...a nice little change of pace and a great break if you are on the road and want a nice stop....

data.title: Fun way to spend the afternoon
data.text: Fun, eclectic shops, interesting finds.  Easily accessible location.  Great way to spend an afternoon with friends.

data.title: Cool place
data.text: Lots of neat (upscale) shoppes. Plenty of food and drink options and cool things to look at. Definitely a progressive area. Glad we made the trip, but we didn't buy much$.

data.title: Delightful and Creative Oasis
data.text: Spent an early evening touring the district - bumped into a few street people (see photos).  Lots of fun shops and restaurants with a very pedestrian friendly environment.  Regret that showers ended our visit prematurely.

data.title: Special Events in the Middle of the District
data.text: Besides all the restaurants, shops, art galleries, and the Monon Trail, I love the special events that are put on every year right in the middle of the downtown area.  They close the streets and they have the Wine and Art Festival, International Art Festival, Artomobilia (huge car show), and many other events.

data.title: Great place to walk, eat, shop and people watch.
data.text:
I love the downtown Carmel Arts and Design district. There are so many things you can do. Many restaurants to choose from. There is Thai, Italian, Cajan, pizza, burgers, and Pubs. There are many shops too. You can walk along the Monon or sit in one of the benches. 
There always seems like there is something going on. Concerts at the gazebo, festivals, etc. Yesterday the Clydesdale Horses were in town.

data.title: Very nice area
data.text: My son and family live in Carmel.  I think Carmel is one of the best small towns in America.  The Arts and Design District has convenient parking, nice restaurants and the lovely green area.  The statues around the area are beautiful.

data.title: Outstanding small city
data.text: Of all the places I have visited in the USA, Carmel is by far the prettiest & well maintained of them all. A big thank you to everyone who maintains that legacy & if you are in the Indianapolis area it is a must see.

data.title: Friendly Area
data.text:
Great place to walk around, stop to check out the small shops and get a bite to eat.
You can ride your bike almost anywhere in Carmel

data.title: Cool place to visit and shop
data.text: Lots of one off shops and places to eat. Several statues up and down the street. We ate there on two different occasions during our 10 day visit to the area. Both places, Bub's Burgers and Bazbeaux's, were both very good.

data.title: Extraordinary!
data.text: I work in the Carmel Arts & Design District and love it! There are plenty of small local flavors, watering holes and mid-range restaurants. Art abounds along with furnishings, jewelry, floral, fashion, theatre and even fitness! Bring your bike or skates and enjoy the Monon running through the Design District. Everyday is a great day in the Design District.

data.title: Fun place
data.text: Little bit of something for everybody.  Carmel did a fantastic job is planning this area out.  Parking is kind of spread out but usually not a problem to find a spot.  Fun, fun, fun.

data.title: nice shopping and good restaurants
data.text: Carmel has done so much to build up this area and make it interesting.  It connects to the Monon bike and hike trail, and it is not far from the Performing Arts Center and the farmer's market.  The shopping is specialized with art and items for the home (such as lighting or plumbing fixtures).  There is an olive oil store and a wine tasting room, and there is a miniature doll house museum.  My favorite places to eat in the district are Scotty's Brewhouse (beer, burgers and more) and Bazbeaux Pizza, both of which have outdoor seating along the Monon, but there are other good places too.

data.title: Great Main Street in Carmel, IN!
data.text: We live within walking distance of the Carmel, Indiana Arts&Design District and have for 20 years. We have watched first hand the explosion of development in our very revitalized downtown. Today Main Street is full of art galleries and restaurants-many local owned gems like Donatello's! After dining or shopping on Main Street take a short walk down The Monon Trail, a beautifully maintained pedestrian pathway to our trio of theaters at The Center for the Performing Arts. I highly recommend spending a sunny afternoon in the Carmel Arts and Design District!

data.title: Alway something to see or do
data.text: The arts district is an amazing collections shops resturants watering holes and the perfect place for people watching. Parking can be a chala get but there are several places if you hit the side streets. There are plenty of venues throuout the year and as far as eating the choice can be as simple as a burger or as unique as Cajun food. The area is alive with people and  street art that makes a great backdrop for you photos

data.title: Fun place to visit
data.text: Carmel has a great downtown that you can walk around. There are a lot of restaurants and little shops. There is also a great deal of art to see and a gateway to the Monon trail. It appears to be very dog friendly.
